title: Applied Energetics to Continue Ultrashort Pulse Laser Program with Office of Naval Research
summary: Applied Energetics, Inc. continues its ultrashort pulse laser program with the Office of Naval Research, transitioning from a grant to a contract. The new contract, valued at $1,217,535, aims to further develop optical technology to disrupt intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance sensors on U.S. Marine Corps platforms. Dr. Greg Quarles, President and CEO of Applied Energetics, expressed enthusiasm for the partnership's continuation, emphasizing the technology's potential to support deployed U.S. military personnel.
article: Applied Energetics to Continue Ultrashort Pulse Laser Program with Office of Naval Research Rhea-AI Impact (Neutral) Rhea-AI Sentiment (Very Positive) Tags Rhea-AI Summary English French German Italian Korean Spanish Applied Energetics, Inc. continues its ultrashort pulse laser program with the Office of Naval Research, transitioning from a grant to a contract. The new contract, valued at $1,217,535, aims to further develop optical technology to disrupt intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance sensors on U.S. Marine Corps platforms. Dr. Greg Quarles, President and CEO of Applied Energetics, expressed enthusiasm for the partnership's continuation, emphasizing the technology's potential to support deployed U.S. military personnel. Applied Energetics, Inc. prosegue il suo programma di laser a impulsi ultracorti con l'Office of Naval Research, passando da una sovvenzione a un contratto. Il nuovo contratto, del valore di $1.217.535, ha l'obiettivo di sviluppare ulteriormente la tecnologia ottica per disturbare i sensori di intelligence, sorveglianza e ricognizione sulle piattaforme del Corpo dei Marines degli Stati Uniti. Il Dr. Greg Quarles, Presidente e CEO di Applied Energetics, ha espresso entusiasmo per la continuazione della partnership, sottolineando il potenziale della tecnologia a supporto del personale militare statunitense dispiegato. Applied Energetics, Inc. continúa su programa de láser de pulsos ultracortos con la Office of Naval Research, pasando de una subvención a un contrato. El nuevo contrato, valorado en $1.217.535, tiene como objetivo avanzar en el desarrollo de tecnología óptica para interferir con los sensores de inteligencia, vigilancia y reconocimiento en las plataformas del Cuerpo de Marines de EE. UU. El Dr. Greg Quarles, presidente y director ejecutivo de Applied Energetics, expresó su entusiasmo por la continuación de la asociación, enfatizando el potencial de la tecnología para apoyar al personal militar estadounidense desplegado. Applied Energetics, Inc.는 해군 연구국과의 초단펄스 레이저 프로그램을 지속하며 보조금에서 계약으로 전환했습니다. 1,217,535달러의 가치가 있는 새로운 계약은 미 해병대 플랫폼에서 정보, 감시 탐지 센서를 방해하기 위한 광학 기술을 추가 개발하는 것을 목표로 합니다. Applied Energetics의 대표이자 CEO인 Greg Quarles 박사는 이 파트너십이 계속되어 기쁘다고 표현하며, 배치된 미군 인력을 지원할 기술의 잠재력을 강조했습니다. Applied Energetics, Inc. continue son programme de lasers à impulsions ultracourtes avec le Bureau de la recherche navale, passant d'une subvention à un contrat. Le nouveau contrat, d'une valeur de 1 217 535 dollars, vise à développer davantage la technologie optique pour perturber les capteurs de renseignement, de surveillance et de reconnaissance sur les plateformes du Corps des Marines américain. Le Dr. Greg Quarles, président et PDG de Applied Energetics, a exprimé son enthousiasme pour la continuation du partenariat, soulignant le potentiel de la technologie à soutenir le personnel militaire américain déployé. Applied Energetics, Inc. setzt sein Programm für ultrakurze Puls-Laser mit dem Office of Naval Research fort, wobei der Übergang von einem Zuschuss zu einem Vertrag erfolgt. Der neue Vertrag mit einem Wert von $1.217.535 zielt darauf ab, die optische Technologie weiterzuentwickeln, um Aufklärungs-, Überwachungs- und Erkennungssensoren auf Plattformen des U.S. Marine Corps zu stören. Dr. Greg Quarles, Präsident und CEO von Applied Energetics, zeigte sich begeistert von der Fortsetzung der Partnerschaft und betonte das Potenzial der Technologie, das eingesetzte US-Militärpersonal zu unterstützen. Positive Transition from grant to contract with ONR for ultrashort pulse laser program New contract valued at $1,217,535 with a base period through November 2024 Focus on developing optical technology to disrupt ISR sensors on USMC platforms Dr. Greg Quarles highlights the technology's potential to support deployed military personnel Negative None. 04/19/2024 - 08:30 AM Grant awarded in May of 2022 transitions to new contract to fund ongoing development and testing of the Company's capabilities to disrupt intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance sensors TUCSON, AZ / ACCESSWIRE / April 19, 2024 / Applied Energetics, Inc. (OTCQB:AERG), a leader in the advancement of ultrashort pulse laser technologies (USPL), announced today that the Company's existing ultra short pulse laser program with the Office of Naval Research (ONR) has transitioned from a grant to a contract. The Company's previously awarded grant with ONR was for the development of an optical system capable of defeating customer-specified threats for integration onto U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) platforms. The original grant had a two-year period of performance. The new contract supersedes the May 2022 grant and carries a ceiling value of $1,217,535 under a base period of performance through November 11, 2024, and a twelve-month unfunded option period that ends November 11, 2025. The Company previously filed an 8-K related to this matter with the Securities & Exchange Commission on March 12, 2024."Applied Energetics is pleased to announce ONR's commitment to continue to support and advance the development of our optical and photonics-based technology for the USMC. Our work will continue evolving the capability set and further expedite the transition of the technology from the laboratory to the field in support of our deployed U.S. military personnel," said Dr. Greg Quarles, President and CEO of Applied Energetics.Applied Energetics was awarded this contract with ONR to enable the continued development and accelerate the testing of its optical technology with an ultrashort pulse laser (USPL). The overall objective will be to advance and ruggedize optical technologies that are compatible with USMC platforms and able to operate in expeditionary environments.Any opinions, findings, and conclusions or recommendations expressed in this press release are those of the Company and do not necessarily reflect the views of the Office of Naval Research.About Applied Energetics, Inc.Applied Energetics, Inc., a leader in Advanced Optical Technologies and Ultrashort Pulse Directed Energy Solutions, utilizes patented, dual-use laser and optical technologies to advance critical industries, including defense, national security, biomedical and manufacturing.
